column4: anyone know why my mouse would just stop working all the time?
possible hardware conflict/
the logs seem to suggest that also, any idea how i  might fix it?
find which hardware is  useing same irq and try and set it to a different irq
http://paste.ubuntu.com/25142/
is the logitech a multi usb port
no, the logitech is the mouse -- it's a wireless logitech laser mouse
shows it disconnecting and reconnecting prob not a conflict  not sure might check that battery isn't loose or receiver in the usb socket loose
i'm assuming your useing a laptop
yep, a dell inspiron 8600
the mouse is plugged directly into one of the 2 main usb ports, and the other is taken up by a powered 7-port hub, mostly filled with external HDDs
or battery may be low and the signal gets blocked it for sure is connecting and recionnecting according to your pastebin
battery is freshly charged...
how do you change the IRQ of a device?
irq don't much matter on usb
hmm, so you have any more ideas?
does it seem to get lost in a certain are or position ?

hmm, i haven't noticed. that one could take me days to diagnose :) however when the mouse stops working I can just switch right on over to the touchpad which works fine, and i don't have this problem in windows..
k that kinda answers my thinking if no prob in windows it not a position prob
i'm blank on any other ideas sorry
it's cool, thanks for trying :)
